    Adds a new VaultListener
    boolean addToVault​(ResourceContainer container)
    If a container for a specific ResourceType already exists, the method simply adds the quantity to it
    otherwise it creates the relative ResourceType key element in the HashMap
    boolean addToVault​(java.util.ArrayList<ResourceContainer> inputArr)
    For each element of inputArr it calls the method that adds a single ResourceContainer to the HashMap
    boolean canRemoveFromVault​(ResourceContainer inputContainer)
    Checks if a specific element inside of inputArr is present in the HashMap and if they can be subtracted
    If everything goes right the element is added bufferArr

    Checks if a series of elements inside of inputArr is present in the HashMap and if they can be subtracted
    if everything goes right bufferMap is put "=" to inputArr

  • Method Details

    • addToVault

      public boolean addToVault​(java.util.ArrayList<ResourceContainer> inputArr)
      For each element of inputArr it calls the method that adds a single ResourceContainer to the HashMap
      Parameters:
      inputArr - is an ArrayList of ResourceContainer
      Returns:
      true

    • addToVault

      public boolean addToVault​(ResourceContainer container)
      If a container for a specific ResourceType already exists, the method simply adds the quantity to it
      otherwise it creates the relative ResourceType key element in the HashMap
      Returns:
      true

    • removeFromVault

      public boolean removeFromVault()
      For each element of bufferMap it calls the method that remove a single ResourceContainer to the HashMap
      this method needs to be called after canRemoveFrom Vault
      Returns:
      true

    • removeFromVault

      public boolean removeFromVault​(ResourceContainer inputContainer)
      The method removes a specific quantity of a specific resource type from the HashMap
      this method needs to be called after canRemoveFrom Vault
      Parameters:
      inputContainer - is a single ResourceContainer
      Returns:
      true

    • canRemoveFromVault

      public boolean canRemoveFromVault​(java.util.ArrayList<ResourceContainer> inputArr) throws NotEnoughResources
      Checks if a series of elements inside of inputArr is present in the HashMap and if they can be subtracted
      if everything goes right bufferMap is put "=" to inputArr
      Parameters:
      inputArr - is an array of ResourceContainer. It contains a list of elements
      (they must be different from each other) and we need to check if they are in the Vault
      Returns:
      true if the elements in inputArr are present in the HashMap
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResources - if it doesn't contain a specific ResourceType OR if it doesn't contain enough resources of that specific ResourceType

    • canRemoveFromVault

      public boolean canRemoveFromVault​(ResourceContainer inputContainer) throws NotEnoughResources
      Checks if a specific element inside of inputArr is present in the HashMap and if they can be subtracted
      If everything goes right the element is added bufferArr
      Returns:
      true if the ResourceType of inputContainer is present as a Key and if the quantity can be removed
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResources - if it doesn't contain a specific ResourceType OR if it doesn't contain enough resources of that specific ResourceType

    • clearBuffer

      public boolean clearBuffer()
      Clears the buffer containing elements that needs to be removed
      Returns:
      true

    • totalQuantityOfResourcesInVault

      public int totalQuantityOfResourcesInVault()
      Returns the total amount of resources present in the vault
